posts.name: El Puesto
posts.note: Bi-level eatery with floor-to-ceiling windows serving an innovative, locally sourced Mexican menu.

posts.name: Fat Sal's *
posts.note: Counter-serve chain featuring creative heroes, wraps burgers, hot dogs and sides in a hip space. The sandwich t get is the Fat Sal sandwich.

posts.name: Georges at the Cove *
posts.note: Renowned chef Trey Foshee's seafood-centric cuisine served in an elegant setting with ocean views.

posts.name: Hodad's *
posts.note: At this burger joint patrons can dine inside restored cars or amid license plate-covered walls.

posts.name: Karl Strauss Brewery
posts.note: Karl Strauss Brewery is San Diego's first microbrewery, known for its full-flavored, hand-crafted beer and six brewery restaurants. Their bar food menu is great and you should try their pork chop dish which was huge last time I had one.

posts.name: Las Cuatro Milpas
posts.note: Old-school Mexican joint earning fans with its homemade tortillas and picnic-table decor since 1933. Pork tamales with rice and beans are the dish to get.

posts.name: Lion's Share
posts.note: Intimate, moody bar pairing handcrafted drinks with New American plates featuring exotic meats.

posts.name: Phil's BBQ *
posts.note: Casual eatery and bar for signature mesquite-barbecued baby-back & beef ribs, plus sandwiches and sides.

posts.name: Tajima Ramen Bar
posts.note: Ramen restaurant with an industrial-chic design has several toppings to choose from and rice bowls.
